body: Good idea, shouldn't be too hard to add either.

Maybe I try to implement it myself. 
@archseer Can you maybe give me some hints how and where to start?

Take a look at how FilePicker is used in the code (it's just a picker with a file preview), i.e. https://github.com/helix-editor/helix/blob/deb7ee6595644accf88e0232aefe419d6f757365/helix-term/src/commands/lsp.rs#L74

A new command has to be added that builds a FilePicker from doc.diagnostics()

I'm working on it with hx. Nice way to learn the editor.

So I create two functions: `diagnostics_picker` and `workspace_diagnostics_picker`
Does the LSP spec provide a way to get diagnostics for the whole workspace ?
LSP seems to send diagnostic messages for all file, hx just filters them on receive for open documents.

issue.title: Add workspace and document diagnostics picker

labels.name: S-waiting-on-review
labels.description: Status: Awaiting review from a maintainer.

issue.body:
fixes #1891

I mapped it to `SPC g` and `SPC G` but feel free to suggest better mappings. Also the style of the picker's lines is open for discussion.

I thought about adding another box on top of the code preview to display the whole diagnostic message without clipping. This adds more space to the list to display the uri. 
But requires implementing a custom picker and may introduce a lot of code duplication or extending the existing picker in a smart way.  

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1053180/162327620-e602a755-9669-4fdc-81d0-66bb86659dc5.png)

issue.title: Show complete list of diagnostics in project
issue.body:
<!-- Your feature may already be reported!
Please search on the issue tracker before creating one. -->

#### Describe your feature request

I think it would be helpful to have a command display a popup list of all diagnostics, similar to the file picker or symbol picker. Would make navigating problems in a project much more fluid.

body: hi, will this be added to 22.08 release ?
Yep. Anything merged into master that hasn't since been reverted (nothing comes to mind) will be included in the next release.
